content:
• Tuesday, August 30, 2011
  • CCUR

    Concurrent Computer (OTC:CCUR) FQ4 earnings beat estimates, but EPS and revenue were both...

    Concurrent Computer (OTC:CCUR) FQ4 earnings beat estimates, but EPS and revenue were both significantly lower than Y/Y comps due to weak sales. Margins came in at 56%, down 9% on higher fixed costs and interest-related expenses. Shares -7.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • VRA

    More on Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q2 earnings +49% Y/Y as its bottom line benefited from an...

    More on Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q2 earnings +49% Y/Y as its bottom line benefited from an increase in direct sales and a favorable product assortment. The company raises FY11 guidance, now expecting net revenues to be in the range of $438M to $443M versus analysts' expectations for $435.8M. Shares +6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • APEOF

    Canadian driller Americas Petrogas (OTCPK:APEOF) soars over +22% today, after signing an...

    Canadian driller Americas Petrogas (OTCPK:APEOF) soars over +22% today, after signing an agreement with Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) to jointly explore for shale oil and gas in Argentina.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • DRYS

    More on DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q2 misses on all counts due to higher-than-expected impairment...

    More on DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q2 misses on all counts due to higher-than-expected impairment costs and losses stemming from interest-rate derivative swaps. Shares -13.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • PVH

    More on Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q2 earnings beat across-the-board on a 30% jump in...

    More on Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q2 earnings beat across-the-board on a 30% jump in revenue from its Tommy Hilfiger line, and a 19% increase in Calvin Klein sales. The company guides FY12 EPS higher, now seeing $5.12 vs $4.98 consensus and revenues of $5.82B vs $6.11B. Shares +2.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • PVH

    Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q2 EPS of $1.07 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $1.3B (+21% Y/Y)...

    Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q2 EPS of $1.07 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $1.3B (+21% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • BEAT

    CardioNet (NASDAQ:BEAT), a provider of patient health monitoring services, is down 18.8% after...

    CardioNet (NASDAQ:BEAT), a provider of patient health monitoring services, is down 18.8% after disclosing in an 8-K that it has received a Civil Investigative Demand from the DOJ related to an investigation of potentially inappropriate Medicare claims.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • BB

    Much-maligned Research In Motion (RIMM +5.9%) continues its improbable run, with shares up 49%...

    Much-maligned Research In Motion (RIMM +5.9%) continues its improbable run, with shares up 49% since their 2011 low set Aug. 9. There's no news outside longstanding themes: It's a potential takeover target, and new phones could boost results (I, II, III). And analysts have served up a roughly equal number of positive (I, II) and negative (I, II) reports in recent weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF) is down 11% AH after the company says Carl Icahn will sell 44M shares,...

    Lions Gate (LGF) is down 11% AH after the company says Carl Icahn will sell 44M shares, representing almost his entire stake in the company. As part of the agreement, both parties agree to dismiss outstanding litigation and release each other from future claims.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO), a maker of flash memory subsystems for servers, is up 9.3% on the day. The...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO), a maker of flash memory subsystems for servers, is up 9.3% on the day. The company could be getting a lift from the announcement of a new product meant for use in servers running virtualization software, the fruits of Fusion-io's recent acquisition of IO Turbine.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +5.1%) shares power higher on hopes subscribers will choose its pricier plans for...

    Netflix (NFLX +5.1%) shares power higher on hopes subscribers will choose its pricier plans for combined DVD and streaming, which begin this Thursday. "A lot of investors believe that the price increase is going to be received more favorably than [they did] when it was first announced," Wedbush says, because customers have no place else to go.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 6 Comments
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK -4.4%) shares are lower this afternoon after the company reported a Q2 loss late...

    LDK Solar (LDK -4.4%) shares are lower this afternoon after the company reported a Q2 loss late yesterday, followed by downgrades this morning at Wells Fargo and Needham.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • NVAX

    Shares of vaccine maker Novavax (NVAX +13.7%) jump after the United Nations reports of a...

    Shares of vaccine maker Novavax (NVAX +13.7%) jump after the United Nations reports of a resurgence in bird flu cases in Asia, Europe and the Middle East.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta (MLM +0.8%) gains after Jefferies names the stock as one of its top picks,...

    Martin Marietta (MLM +0.8%) gains after Jefferies names the stock as one of its top picks, citing the long-term potential of the company's business portfolio and an established distribution network.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +15.2%) soar after SEC filings reveal insider buying from...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +15.2%) soar after SEC filings reveal insider buying from multiple executives after the stock reached its 52-week low earlier this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • RDC

    Rowan Companies (RDC +1.3%) trades up on the day after being raised to outperform at Macquarie...

    Rowan Companies (RDC +1.3%) trades up on the day after being raised to outperform at Macquarie on valuation. The firm cites Rowan's top-tier jack-up fleet and recent entry into the deepwater market as a positive driver for future earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • EXP

    Eagle Materials (EXP +1.9%) is up today after Jefferies raises it to buy, saying the economic...

    Eagle Materials (EXP +1.9%) is up today after Jefferies raises it to buy, saying the economic and housing crises have left stocks in the global building-materials sector significantly undervalued.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • BOBE

    Bob Evans Farms (BOBE -2.4%) and Cracker Barrel (CBRL -1.5%) are weak today after SunTrust...

    Bob Evans Farms (BOBE -2.4%) and Cracker Barrel (CBRL -1.5%) are weak today after SunTrust lowers its ratings to neutral (I, II), citing pricing pressures from major casual dining chains.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • MU

    Sanford Bernstein’s Mark Newman thinks the recent rebound in DRAM chip prices is...

    Sanford Bernstein’s Mark Newman thinks the recent rebound in DRAM chip prices is “highly likely to be short-lived,” reiterating a Market Perform rating on Micron (MU -3.2%). Contract prices will continue to drop, narrowing the gap with spot prices, pushed down by a cleaning of inventory by PC makers. He also sees more NAND flash memory and less DRAM in future PCs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • CWEI

    Clayton Williams Energy (CWEI -3.7%) is lower today after revising downward its 2011 financial...

    Clayton Williams Energy (CWEI -3.7%) is lower today after revising downward its 2011 financial forecast for exploration and development. The driller now plans to spend $385M on E&P activities, $54M less than previously forecast, and plans to scale back on oil-drilling plans for its site in Reeves County, Texas.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • FLWS

    Despite an FQ4 earnings report showing narrower losses and double-digit sales growth,...

    Despite an FQ4 earnings report showing narrower losses and double-digit sales growth, 1-800-Flowers.com (FLWS -2.9%) trades lower after the online florist cuts its FY12 forecast due to a weak economy and flagging consumer demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • FRO

    Shipping stocks recover as the sector looks a little downtrodden to investors after a harsh 71%...

    Shipping stocks recover as the sector looks a little downtrodden to investors after a harsh 71% cut on the price target for Frontline (FRO +15.2%) by FBR Capital rocked  firms yesterday. Gainers in the sector include: OSG +4.8%, DRYS +3%, PRGN +4.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLMS

    Calamos Asset Management (CLMS -7.7%) takes a hit today after KBW cut the shares to market...

    Calamos Asset Management (CLMS -7.7%) takes a hit today after KBW cut the shares to market perform, citing the increased uncertainty of its earnings due to market volatility.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • SVRA

    Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX +12%) pops after saying it's arranged a meeting with the FDA to...

    Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX +12%) pops after saying it's arranged a meeting with the FDA to discuss the approval of three late-stage pipeline products: ANX-514, ANX-188 and Exelbine.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • TXI

    Texas Industries (TXI +4.3%) is trading higher at mid-day after Jefferies upgrades the shares to...

    Texas Industries (TXI +4.3%) is trading higher at mid-day after Jefferies upgrades the shares to a buy on valuation, citing a recovery in its major markets in Texas and California. Separately, KeyBanc initiates with a hold.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • PHI

    PHI (PHI +17.8%) soars after a report details the firm is asking a federal court to sanction...

    PHI (PHI +17.8%) soars after a report details the firm is asking a federal court to sanction Sikorsky Aircraft - the manufacturer of a helicopter that crashed leading to damage awards from PHI. Sikorsky, owned by United Technologies(UTX -0.2%), withheld a report from an engineer stating a faulty design led to the crash in 2009, according to court filings.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • CBI

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +4.3%) is trading higher this morning after being initiated with...

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +4.3%) is trading higher this morning after being initiated with a Buy at UBS with a price target of $41.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • TOL

    Susquehanna issues a somewhat back-handed upgrade to three homebuilders today, upping them on...

    Susquehanna issues a somewhat back-handed upgrade to three homebuilders today, upping them on valuation only after cutting its new home sales forecast to 339K from 355K. The firm raises Toll Brothers (TOL +1.5%) and NVR (NVR +1.1%) to positive, and KB Home (KBH +10%) to neutral (I, II, III), but asserts the ratings changes simply reflect current valuations relative to its revised forecast.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • STEC

    STEC (STEC +4.3%) pops after boosting its existing stock buyback program by another $40M, adding...

    STEC (STEC +4.3%) pops after boosting its existing stock buyback program by another $40M, adding to the $15M of shares the company bought earlier this month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • CWST

    Casella Waste Systems (CWST +7%) is up this morning after its FQ1 beat on better revenue due to...

    Casella Waste Systems (CWST +7%) is up this morning after its FQ1 beat on better revenue due to higher solid waste and commodity recycling prices. Net losses widened however, as weak volume pressures revenue growth, and higher operating costs at its landfills weigh down bottom line margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • VDSI-OLD

    Vasco Data Security International (VDSI-OLD -6.3%) trades lower after a hacker broke into its...

    Vasco Data Security International (VDSI-OLD -6.3%) trades lower after a hacker broke into its DigiNotar unit and issued fraudulent public certificates for a number of key domains, including Google.com. The certificates are used to encrypt information and provide authentication online.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +10.1%) pops after Gabelli ups it to buy from hold, citing the stock's...

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +10.1%) pops after Gabelli ups it to buy from hold, citing the stock's "compelling value" and expectations the school will renegotiate better terms on its credit agreement next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • NBGGY

    National Bank of Greece (NBG -13%) reports a H1 loss of €1.3B after taking a write-down of...

    National Bank of Greece (NBG -13%) reports a H1 loss of €1.3B after taking a write-down of €1.65B on its holdings of Greek paper. Street Insider reports the CEO as saying the bank is examining strategic moves. Shares jumped more than 30% yesterday on the merger of Greece's 2nd and 3rd largest lenders.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • KODK

    A jump in Eastman Kodak (EK +4.9%) shares is attributed to comments from CEO Antonio Perez that...

    A jump in Eastman Kodak (EK +4.9%) shares is attributed to comments from CEO Antonio Perez that the company has signed confidentiality agreements with several potential buyers of patents it put up for sale last month. The 1,100-plus patents Kodak put up for sale July 20 may generate more than $2B in cash, MDB Capital Group says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • EMR

    Emerson Electric (EMR -2.5%) is lower this morning after Argus cuts it to hold over concerns...

    Emerson Electric (EMR -2.5%) is lower this morning after Argus cuts it to hold over concerns about the company's Q3 operating margins due to weak economic conditions in the U.S. and Western Europe.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks (AMCX +3.5%) posts a tidy gain after a couple of analysts weigh in with positive...

    AMC Networks (AMCX +3.5%) posts a tidy gain after a couple of analysts weigh in with positive comments. BofA launches coverage with a Buy rating and a $42 PT - noting a sale of the company is "plausible," while Barclays upgrades to Equal Weight from Underweight on "reasonable" valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • PHM

    PulteGroup (PHM +5.1%) pops after Ticonderoga analyst Stephen East raises his rating on shares...

    PulteGroup (PHM +5.1%) pops after Ticonderoga analyst Stephen East raises his rating on shares to Buy from Neutral, and sets a $6.50 price target. He sees plenty of upside for the stock, despite a rally over the last week that has seen shares gain 30% after an even steeper fall.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • S

    Wells Fargo reiterates an Outperform on Sprint (S +3.5%) after channel checks show the carrier...

    Wells Fargo reiterates an Outperform on Sprint (S +3.5%) after channel checks show the carrier to be faring well against Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) and AT&T (NYSE:T), against whom it's struggled in recent years. The firm speculates Sprint, which soared recently on a report it will carry the next iPhone, may be getting a boost from its cheap data pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) is up 17.5% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $1.42B (+2% Y/Y) and...

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) is up 17.5% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $1.42B (+2% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.94; the former beat consensus by $20M, while the latter was in-line. NOOK-related sales rose 140% Y/Y to $277M. The company expects FY12 revenue of $7.4B and EPS of -$0.10 to -$0.50, compared with a consensus of $7.38B and -$0.17.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • PERY

    Shares of Perry Ellis (PERY +5.1%) shoot higher on the open after BofA upgrades its rating to...

    Shares of Perry Ellis (PERY +5.1%) shoot higher on the open after BofA upgrades its rating to Buy from Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +0.9%) approves the launch of the new engine variant of the 737, based on order...

    Boeing (BA +0.9%) approves the launch of the new engine variant of the 737, based on order commitments for 496 airplanes from five airlines. Nomura raises its rating to Neutral from Reduce, citing the stock's relative valuation, the startup of 787 Dreamliner deliveries, and demand for the re-engined 737.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • MIPS

    MIPS Technologies (NASDAQ:MIPS), a rival to ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) in the market for licensed...

    MIPS Technologies (NASDAQ:MIPS), a rival to ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) in the market for licensed processor designs, is up 4.8% after Capstone's Jeff Schreiner upgrades shares to Buy. Schreiner sees MIPS holding much value to a potential acquirer (perhaps a PE firm), given its "strong potential free cash flow" and large cash balances.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) is up 8.5% premarket after announcing favorable results for a...

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) is up 8.5% premarket after announcing favorable results for a Phase 3 study related to its AEZS-130 drug for treating adult growth hormone deficiency. The company now plans to consult with the FDA regarding the submission of a new drug application (NDA).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • LLNW

    Premarket gainers: LLNW +10%. AEZS +8%. PANL +6%. TGB +4%. DG +3%.Losers: NBG -9%. CEDC -7%....

    Premarket gainers: LLNW +10%. AEZS +8%. PANL +6%. TGB +4%. DG +3%.
    Losers: NBG -9%. CEDC -7%. LVLT -4%. ASBC -4%. FRO -3%. DB -3%. FMS -3%. GSK -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GLD

    Gold crashes upward, jumping $40 in the space of a few bars, now trading at $1,830/oz. Shares in...

    Gold crashes upward, jumping $40 in the space of a few bars, now trading at $1,830/oz. Shares in Europe are U.S. index futures are down a bit, but not enough to cause that sort of move into the metal. GLD +2.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • DSW

    Shares of DSW (NYSE:DSW) are up 5% premarket after beating Q2 EPS estimates by $0.11 on revenue...

    Shares of DSW (NYSE:DSW) are up 5% premarket after beating Q2 EPS estimates by $0.11 on revenue of $476M (+16% Y/Y). The company raised guidance for FY11 EPS to $2.70-$2.85, from $2.65-$2.80, on the strength of growth in its men's and accessories segments.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • DG

    More on Dollar General (NYSE:DG) FQ2: Same-store sales +5.9%, an acceleration from Q1. DG ups...

    More on Dollar General (NYSE:DG) FQ2: Same-store sales +5.9%, an acceleration from Q1. DG ups the low-end of its FY earnings guidance range to reflect same-store sales growth of 4%-6%; the company now expects total sales to rise 12%-14% and adjusted EPS of $2.22-$2.30. Shares +3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • LLNW

    Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) soars 9.3% after announcing it will sell its EyeWonder online...

    Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) soars 9.3% after announcing it will sell its EyeWonder online advertising unit to DG (NASDAQ:DGIT) for $66M in cash - money the company can definitely use, given its rate of cash burn. Dan Rayburn had reported that Limelight was looking to sell EyeWonder, and perhaps merge its content delivery network (CDN) assets with Level 3's (NASDAQ:LVLT) CDN business.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • TEVA

    Drug developer NuPathe (PATH) is down 51.5% premarket after announcing the FDA has rejected its...

    Drug developer NuPathe (PATH) is down 51.5% premarket after announcing the FDA has rejected its Zeltrix migraine patch, due to "chemistry, manufacturing, and safety questions." NuPathe had planned to launch Zeltrix in 1H 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • RBS

    U.K. banks are soaring in London after Deutsche Bank upgrades RBS (NYSE:RBS) to Buy from Hold,...

    U.K. banks are soaring in London after Deutsche Bank upgrades RBS (NYSE:RBS) to Buy from Hold, saying the recent falls across the industry have gone too far. "We think the sector valuation will prove attractive in hindsight," the broker said. RBS +10.5%, Barclays (NYSE:BCS) +8.3%, Lloyds (NYSE:LYG) +7.7%, HSBC (HBC) +3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 AM
